required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sedation Effect of Dexmedetomidine Versus Remifentanil to Fibreoptic Intubation
clinical_study.official_title: Dexmedetomidine Versus Remifentanil Target Controlled Infusion for Sedation During Awake Fibreoptic Nasotracheal Intubation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the sedation effect of dexmedetomidine and target controlled remifentanil for awake nasotracheal fibreoptic intubation in patients undergoing oral maxillofacial surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Awake fibreoptic nasotracheal intubation is an effective technique for the management of patients with difficult airways undergoing oral maxillofacial surgery. Both optimal intubating conditions and patient comfort are paramount while preparing the patient for fibreoptic intubation. One challenge associated with procedure is to provide adequate sedation while maintaining patients' airway ventilation. Dexmedetomidine, because of its sedative,analgesic properties and minimal influence on patients' ventilation, might be a useful management for it. While with the development of target controlled infusion (TCI) technology, remifentanil sedation becomes a potential sedation in clinical practice.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: during the procedure of fibreoptic and tracheal intubation
primary_outcome.description: Endoscopy was graded from 0 to 5, with lower scores indicating a possibly better condition. Endoscopy score 0 1 2 3 4 5: 1)Grimacing 2)localising 3)Coughing on lignocaine via scope 4)Coughing on entering infraglottic space 5)Prolonged coughing

primary_outcome.time_frame: during the inserting of the tracheal tube
primary_outcome.description: graded from 0 to 5, with lower scores indicating better conditions Intubation score 0 1 2 3 4 5: 1)Grimacing when tube in nares 2)Localising with one limb at any stage 3)Localising with two limbs at any stage 4)Coughing on entering trachea 5)Prolonged coughing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the duration of intubation, an expected average of 10 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Ramsay score during the endoscopy intubation from 1 to 6. The higher scores means the deeper sedation level. Clinical score Level of sedation Patient is anxious and agitated or restless, or both Patient is cooperative, oriented and tranquil Patient responds to commands only Patient exhibits a brisk response to a light glabellar (between the eyebrows) tap or loud auditory stimulus Patient exhibits a sluggish response to a light glabellar tap or loud auditory stimulus Patient exhibits no response to stimuli

visit the patients to ensure their memory of intubation. Postoperative interview asked the patients' memory of the fiberoptic intubation Amnesia Recall of endoscopy Yes No Recall of intubation Yes No The number is the patients who remember the operation procedure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes before intubation, endoscopy point, intubation point
secondary_outcome.description: MAP at 15 minutes before intuation, endoscopy point and intubation point between two groups were compared.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes before intubation, endoscopy point, intubation point
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate at 15 minutes before intuation, endoscopy point and intubation point between two groups were compared.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes before intubation, endoscopy point, intubation point
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral oxygen saturation at 15 minutes before intuation, endoscopy point and intubation point between two groups were compared.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes before intubation and duration of intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Abnormal Cardiac Rhythm(including any type of the abnormal cardiac rhythm from 15 minutes before intubation and during the intubation procedure was recorded such as sinus arrhythm, atrial or ventricular premature beats and atrioventricular block) was recorded.
Post-intubation was scored from 1 to 3, with higher scores indicating a worse outcome. Post-intubation score 1 2 3 Cooperative, obeying commands Uncomfortable, GA imminent Other（specify）

arm_group.description: a loading dose (1.5mcg/kg) infused over10 min followed by a continuous infusion of 0.7 μg/kg/h

The initial target was 3.0 ng/ml and the TCI was adjusted by 0.5 ng/ml after the target concentration at the effect site had equilibrated with the plasma concentration, until the desired level of sedation was acheived.

intervention.description: 1-1.5cmg/kg dexmedetomidine infusion within 10 minutes, while followed by maintainly infusing 0.7cmg/kg/min dexmedetomidine
target controlled 3.5-4ng/ml remifentanil infused(blood plasma concentration)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA grade I-III adult patients with difficult airway, who were undergoing elective oral maxillofacial surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant or lactating female,
- long-term opioids or sedative medication,
- patients < 18 years of age,
- severe bradycardia (HR < 50 beats/min),
- hypotension (systolic pressure < 90mmHg),
- any type of atrioventricular block on the ECG

overall_official.affiliation: Anesthesiology Department, Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated Shanghai JiaoTong University School of Medicine

facility.name: Shanghai JiaoTong University, School of Medicine
Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University, School of Medicine

responsible_party.investigator_title: consultant in anesthesilogy department of Shanghai 9th People's Hospital

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Forty two adult patients, American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) score of I-III, were recruited for an elective awake fibreoptic nasotracheal intubation due to the diagnosis of maxillofacial cancer or fracture with limited mouth opening
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: One patient declined consent and one operation was cancelled.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine Infusion for Sedation
group.description: Patients in the dexmedetomidine group received a loading dose (1.5 μg kg–1) infused over10 min followed by a continuous infusion of 0.7 μg kg–1 h–1.

group.title: Remifentanil Target Controlled Infusion
group.description: Patients in the remifentanil group received remifentanil via an Orchestra Base Primea (Fresenius Vial) infusion system using a Minto pharmacokinetic model. The initial target was 3.0 ng ml–1 and the TCI was adjusted by 0.5 ng ml–1 after the target concentration at the effect site had equilibrated with the plasma concentration, until the desired level of sedation was reached.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine Infusion for Sedation
group.description: Patients in the dexmedetomidine group received a loading dose (1.5 μg kg–1) infused over10 min followed by a continuous infusion of 0.7 μg kg–1 h–1.

group.title: Remifentanil Target Controlled Infusion
group.description: Patients in the remifentanil group received remifentanil via an Orchestra Base Primea (Fresenius Vial) infusion system using a Minto pharmacokinetic model. The initial target was 3.0 ng ml–1 and the TCI was adjusted by 0.5 ng ml–1 after the target concentration at the effect site had equilibrated with the plasma concentration, until the desired level of sedation was reached.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Patient's Reaction to Procedure
outcome.description: Ramsay score during the endoscopy intubation from 1 to 6. The higher scores means the deeper sedation level. Clinical score Level of sedation Patient is anxious and agitated or restless, or both Patient is cooperative, oriented and tranquil Patient responds to commands only Patient exhibits a brisk response to a light glabellar (between the eyebrows) tap or loud auditory stimulus Patient exhibits a sluggish response to a light glabellar tap or loud auditory stimulus Patient exhibits no response to stimuli
outcome.time_frame: the duration of intubation, an expected average of 10 minutes
outcome.population: Power calculation identified a minimum requirement of 15 patients randomized to each group to demonstrate a 20% difference in outcome scores with a power of 0.8 and a type I error of 0.05 according to our preliminary study.

group.title: Remifetanil Target Controlled Infusion
group.description: Patients in the remifentanil group received remifentanil via an Orchestra Base Primea (Fresenius Vial) infusion system using a Minto pharmacokinetic model. The initial target was 3.0 ng ml-1 and the TCI was adjusted by 0.5 ng ml-1 after the target concentration at the effect site had equilibrated with the plasma concentration, until the desired level of sedation was reached.

group.description: Patients in the dexmedetomidine group received a loading dose (1.5 μg kg-1) infused over10 min followed by a continuous infusion of 0.7 μg kg-1 h-1.

measure.description: Ramsay score during the endoscopy intubation from 1 to 6. The higher scores means the deeper sedation level. measure.population: Power calculation identified a minimum requirement of 15 patients randomized to each group to demonstrate a 20% difference in outcome scores with a power of 0.8 and a type I error of 0.05 according to our preliminary study.

group.title: Remifetanil Target Controlled Infusion
group.description: Two patients in remifentanil group exhibited bradycardia(heart rate<50beats per minute) during endoscopy and intubation period.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine Continuously Infusion for Sedation
group.description: Three patients in dexmedetomidine group exhibited bradycardia(heart rate<50beats per minute) during endoscopy and intubation period.

outcome.title: Endoscopy Scores
outcome.description: Endoscopy was graded from 0 to 5, with lower scores indicating a possibly better condition. Endoscopy score 0 1 2 3 4 5: 1)Grimacing 2)localising 3)Coughing on lignocaine via scope 4)Coughing on entering infraglottic space 5)Prolonged coughing
outcome.time_frame: during the procedure of fibreoptic and tracheal intubation
outcome.population: Power calculation identified a minimum requirement of 15 patients randomized to each group to demonstrate a 20% difference in outcome scores with a power of 0.8 and a type I error of 0.05 according to our preliminary study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The sample number is relatively small
